articles.title: Look inside this newly renovated Lake Winnipesaukee resort
articles.description:
Travelers can stay in a restored 19th-century linen mill with a 40-foot waterfall.

The post Look inside this newly renovated Lake Winnipesaukee resort appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Explore the newly renovated 19th-century linen mill resort at Lake Winnipesaukee.
Enjoy a unique stay featuring a 40-foot waterfall on the property.
Boston residents can access this destination for a scenic getaway.

articles.title: Boston to spend $135 million in taxpayer dollars for White Stadium overhaul, Wu says
articles.description:
The last cost estimate, from late 2024, was $91 million. A pro women's soccer team will also contribute $190 million.

The post Boston to spend $135 million in taxpayer dollars for White Stadium overhaul, Wu says appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston plans to invest $135 million in taxpayer funds for White Stadium renovations.
The previous estimate was $91 million, indicating a significant budget increase.
A pro women's soccer team will add $190 million to the project, enhancing local sports facilities.

articles.title: Where will ‘underdog’ Patriots fans watch the Super Bowl in Seattle?
articles.description:
It can be a challenge to find a Seattle restaurant to host the thousands of Washington-based Patriots fans in enemy territory.

The post Where will ‘underdog’ Patriots fans watch the Super Bowl in Seattle? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Thousands of Patriots fans in Seattle struggle to find viewing locations for the Super Bowl.
Local restaurants face high demand from Washington-based Patriots supporters during the game.
Boston residents may connect with fellow fans through social media for viewing parties.

articles.title: Waymo wants to expand into Boston. Massachusetts law isn’t ready.
articles.description:
The company has already run test vehicles on city streets, but a rollout hinges on whether the state authorizes autonomous-vehicle operations.

The post Waymo wants to expand into Boston. Massachusetts law isn’t ready. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Waymo has conducted autonomous vehicle tests on Boston streets.
Expansion depends on Massachusetts legislation for autonomous vehicle operations.
Local residents may face delays in accessing autonomous transportation options.

articles.title: Why Justin Herbert MVP voter picked Chargers QB over Drake Maye, Matthew Stafford
articles.description:
Herbert received one of the 50 first-place votes as Maye had one fewer first-place vote than Stafford.

The post Why Justin Herbert MVP voter picked Chargers QB over Drake Maye, Matthew Stafford appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Justin Herbert received one of 50 first-place MVP votes on February 6, 2026.
Drake Maye received 49 votes, one less than Matthew Stafford.
Herbert's recognition may influence local fans' support for the Chargers in Boston.
